meanings.definition: A sound made by something moving quickly through the air.
meanings.sent1: The whoosh of the wind through the trees was calming.
meanings.sent2: I heard a whoosh as the car sped by.
meanings.sent3: The whoosh of the rocket taking off startled the birds nearby.
meanings.sent4: The whoosh of the waterfall drowned out all other sounds.
meanings.sent5: The whoosh of the train passing by was so loud it shook the ground.

meanings.definition: To move quickly with a rushing sound.
meanings.sent1: The roller coaster whooshed down the track.
meanings.sent2: I whooshed past the other runners to take the lead.
meanings.sent3: The kids whooshed down the slide with laughter.
meanings.sent4: Time whooshed by as we enjoyed the sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The wind whooshed through the open window, cooling the room.

meanings.sent1: The cars whooshed by on the highway.
meanings.sent2: I whooshed through my chores to finish early.
meanings.sent3: The cat whooshed past me chasing a butterfly.
meanings.sent4: Thoughts whooshed through my mind as I tried to focus.
meanings.sent5: The ball whooshed through the hoop, scoring the winning point.
